Package calc

Class CalcMain

java.lang.Object
calc.CalcMain
All Implemented Interfaces:
Calculator
public class CalcMain extends Object implements Calculator
Main class of the application. It implements the Calculator interface. The two calculation methods must use the stack provided in the constructor. Additionally, it provides 2 methods to obtain instances of the two different stack implementations.

  • Constructor Details

    • CalcMain

      public CalcMain(GenericStack<Double> stack)
      Constructor for the calculator.
      Parameters:
      stack - an instance of a stack that implements the interface GenericStack
      
public class CalcMain implements Calculator {
    private GenericStack stack;
        
    public CalcMain(GenericStack stack) {
        this.stack = stack;
    }

  • Method Details

    • calcInfix

      public double calcInfix(String[] s) throws CalcException
      performs the calculation on the given input in infix notation. Supported operations are: addition (+), substraction (-), multiplication (*), and division (/). Also parenthesis '(', ')' are allowed.
      Specified by:
      calcInfix in interface Calculator
      Parameters:
      s - the input to the calculation in infix form e.g., ["(", "1.5", "+" , "2", ")", "*", "(", "3", "-", "4", ")"]
      Returns:
      the result of the calculation, e.g. -3.5 for the above input
      Throws:
      CalcException - if anything goes wrong during the calculation (e.g., in case of an illegal input)
      
@Override
public double calcInfix(String[] s) throws CalcException {
    return calcPostfix(Calculator.infix2postfix(s));
}

    • calcPostfix

      public double calcPostfix(String[] s) throws CalcException
      performs the calculation on the given input in postfix notation. Supported operations are: addition (+), substraction (-), multiplication (*), and division (/)
      Specified by:
      calcPostfix in interface Calculator
      Parameters:
      s - the input to the calculation in postfix form e.g., ["1.5", "2", "+", "3", "4", "-", "*"]
      Returns:
      the result of the calculation, e.g. -3.5 for the above input
      Throws:
      CalcException - if anything goes wrong during the calculation (e.g., in case of an illegal input)
      
@Override
public double calcPostfix(String[] s) throws CalcException {
    char c;
    double a = Double.NaN;
    double b = Double.NaN;
    double result;
    
    for(String NumOrOp : s){
        if(NumOrOp.length() == 0){
            //empty expression
            throw new CalcException("The expression contained empty inputs!");
        }
    
        c = NumOrOp.charAt(0);
    
            switch (c) {
                case '+':
                case '-':
                case '*':
                case '/':
                    if(stack.isEmpty())
                        throw new CalcException("Not enough operands!");
                    a = stack.pop();
    
                    if(stack.isEmpty())
                        throw new CalcException("Not enough operands!");
                    b = stack.pop();
    
                    switch(c){
                        case '+':
                            stack.push(b + a);
                            break;
    
                        case '-':
                            stack.push(b - a);
                            break;
    
                        case '*':
                            stack.push(b * a);
                            break;
    
                        case '/':
                            if(b == 0){
                                //Division by 0 error
                                throw new CalcException("Division by 0!");
                            }
                            stack.push(b / a);
                            break;
                        }
                        break;
    
                default:
                    //Not an operation, so expect number
                    try {
                        stack.push(Double.parseDouble(NumOrOp));
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        //input neither operation nor number
                        throw new CalcException("Invalid number input: " + NumOrOp);
                    }
            }
    }
    
    result = stack.pop();
    
    if(!stack.isEmpty())
        throw new CalcException("Not enough operations!");
    else
        return result;
}

    • getArrayStack

      public static GenericStack<Double> getArrayStack(int capacity)
      Creates and returns a new instance of an array-based stack with limited capacity. The stack must not change the capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity of the stack (i.e., maximum number of elements to be stored in the stack)
      Returns:
      an instance of the array-based stack with the given capacity
      
public static GenericStack getArrayStack(int capacity) {
    return new ArrayStack(capacity);
}

    • getListStack

      public static GenericStack<Double> getListStack()
      Creates and returns a new instance of a list-based stack with unbound capacity.
      Returns:
      an instance of a list-based stack (with unbound capacity)
      
public static GenericStack getListStack() {
    return new ListStack();
}
